results.title: Drugs and side effects
results.creator_credit: Tim Abbott, Helen Edwards, Tony Shaddock and Dept of Health, Richmond Implementation Unit
results.brief_description: Designed to provide the intellectual disability care worker with an overview of drugs and society, the role of the careworker, the forms and administration of drugs, the most commonly prescribed drugs, non-prescription or over-the-counter drugs, and suggestions for teaching self administration. Accompanied by a 42p. in-service training manual.

results.title: Drugs - better dead?
results.brief_description: An undramatised documentary which shows the harrowing effects of drug misuse. Young addicts and ex-addicts give accounts of what life is like on various drugs, how they experience withdrawal symptoms and their need for more and more money to buy the drugs. Glimpses are seen of a post-mortem examination being conducted on the body of a young female addict.

results.title: Drink-driving education
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Jan Sharp, Tom Chen, Peter Johnson, Peter Skolinick and New South Wales. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: A compilation of “Drinking, driving, surviving”, “Saturday night again” and “The Thirsty season”. Covers physiological effects of alcohol; the social context and advertising.

results.title: Pot purri
results.creator_credit: Cameron Guers, Derek Lamb, Grant Munro, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Rhoda Leyer, Colin Low, Vic Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A selection of publicity clips mounted together in one film to show techniques of NFB animators. As in ‘Hors d’oeuvre’, these films were produced originally for Government Agencies, to carry a message to the public about fire, water, traffic safety and mailing early for Christmas. Punctuated with adroit sound effects, each clip drives home its message humorously and succinctly.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cameron Guers, Derek Lamb, Grant Munro, Jeffrey Hale, Kaj Pindal, Rhoda Leyer, Colin Low, Vic Jobin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Postman Pat and his black and white cat
results.brief_description: Two episodes of “Postman Pat” Greendale’s favourite postman who loves to deliver the mail with Jess his black and white cat. The first adventure sees Pat, haven broken his own glasses, borrow an old pair of Mrs Goggins. The glasses not being suited to Postman Pat are the cause of a slight muddle as the letters are being delivered to the wrong addresses because Pat can’t read them properly. Pat makes a clay model of his cat Jess, in the second story. He enters it into the Greendale art show where the statue wins a special prize.

results.title: Postman Pat's ABC
results.brief_description: Learn the ABC with Postman Pat. This story takes place in the little village of Greendale. Pat and his trusty companion Jess, the black and white cat, help young Tom Pottage to remember his alphabet. This delightful animation by Ivor Wood is an excellent aid for young children learning the alphabet.

results.title: Posters
results.brief_description: Posters are made for people on the move. This video helps you to design eye catching and effective posters. make your own poster work for you with the technique of colour, letter spacing and design.

results.title: Post coitum = Animal triste
results.creator_credit: Brigitte Rouan, Humbert Balsan, Ognon Pictures and Pinou Film
results.brief_description: Director Brigitte Rouan (in a brave move), casts herself as Diane Clovier, a happily married career woman who falls passionately in love with a man twenty years younger than herself, Emilio (Boris Tegal). She begins an affair with him, and is debilitated by the ensuing desire and love that consumes them while they’re together. Emilio accompanies Diane to Prague where she threatens to ruin her professional reputation by putting her desires before work. Diane’s affair is blatantly obvious to her husband, Phillipe (Patrick Chesnais), however he tacitly lets the affair continue in the hope that it will soon end. When he is employed as the defence lawyer for Madame Dupleche who has been charged with murdering an abusive, unfaithful husband, it causes him, as well as Diane, to question the situation they find themselves in and to discover what makes them happy. Cast includes Boris Terral, Nils Tavernier and Patrick Chesnais. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Posso Cinema Projection Spools
results.brief_description:
1. Posso (brand) cinema projection spools and Posso case in original cardboard box. Made in France. Case: grey plastic base with clear lid. There is a small label on the original box which suggests it was sold for 90 cents. 8mm - 200ft / 60metres.

2 sheets of yellowed paper for safe storage purposes 2. Posso cinema projection spool and Posso plastic case housed in original cardboard box. The reverse of the cardboard box has a tab which says ‘hang for display’ 8mm 400ft / 120 metres Case: grey plastic base with clear lid. 2 sheets of yellowed paper for safe storage purposes: 8mm wide ribbon of card lose in reel.

  1. Posso cinema projection spool with metal core and Posso case housed in original cardboard box. Attached label suggest it was purchased from Grace Bros for $1.35. 8mm 400ft / 120 metres Case: grey plastic base with clear lid. 2 sheets of yellowed paper for safe storage purposes: 8mm wide ribbon of card lose in reel.”

results.title: Pole to pole with Michael Palin
results.creator_credit: Clem Vallance, Roger Mills, BBC, Passepartout Productions and Prominent Television
results.brief_description: If the idea - a trek from the North to the South Pole travelling along the 30 degree East line of longitude - was simplicity itself, the actual journey proved to be quite the opposite. Using every conceivable mode of transport Michael Palin and his crew passed through 17 countries and filmed for five months. What you see is what they saw - warts, bedbugs and all.
